New Records: The Cubs have reached 98 hits, 80 runs, 43 extra-base hits, 18 stolen bases and 14 home runs in their last eight games, a feat that had never been done before in MLB history.
Key Match Events: The Cubs have won 10 of their last 13 games, and are 7-1 in their last eight games.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs' offense has been on fire, scoring at least six runs in seven of their last eight games, and reaching double-digits four times.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cubs' manager praised the team's historic run, saying that they've been playing their best baseball of the year.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs are now three games over.500, and have risen to second place in the NL Central, 10 games back of the Milwaukee Brewers.
Others: The Cubs' leadoff man, Ian Happ, has led the charge for the team, batting.400/.475/.686 with 14 hits, including seven doubles, over the last eight games.
